caption:
The photograph captures an expansive aerial view of a dense urban skyline, characterized by numerous high-rise buildings. The architecture varies significantly among the structures, comprising a mix of apartment buildings, commercial offices, and hotels. Many of the buildings are modern, with glass facades, while others are made of concrete and display older architectural styles.

In the background, the cityscape is bordered by lush green hills, hinting at the geographical setting that includes natural landscapes close to the urban area. The predominant colors in the image are the grey and white of the buildings, contrasted against the dark green of the distant hills and a pale blue sky.

From this vantage point, the image provides a detailed look at the urban planning and architectural diversity of the city, showcasing a tightly packed metropolitan area that has developed vertically, likely due to geographic constraints imposed by the surrounding natural landscape.
title: Massed highrises of waikiki district, favorite of tourists seen from top of diamond head, the famous extinct volcano.  The waikiki improvement association has formed an architectural design review board to oversee such building, but it is probably too late.  In 1963 there were 9,203 hotel rooms in all of Oahu island.  Today there are some 26,000 rooms, most of them here in waikiki
